fr.sorbonne_u.components.hem2022e3.equipments.heater.sil

Class HeaterStateModel

  • java.lang.Object
    • fr.sorbonne_u.devs_simulation.models.Model
      • fr.sorbonne_u.devs_simulation.models.AtomicModel
        • fr.sorbonne_u.components.hem2022e3.equipments.heater.sil.HeaterStateModel
  • All Implemented Interfaces:
    HeaterOperationI, fr.sorbonne_u.devs_simulation.interfaces.EventsExchangingI, fr.sorbonne_u.devs_simulation.interfaces.ModelDescriptionI, fr.sorbonne_u.devs_simulation.interfaces.VariableInitialisationI, fr.sorbonne_u.devs_simulation.interfaces.VariablesSharingI, fr.sorbonne_u.devs_simulation.models.interfaces.AtomicModelI, fr.sorbonne_u.devs_simulation.models.interfaces.ModelI, java.io.Serializable

    @ModelExternalEvents(imported={SwitchOnHeater.class,SwitchOffHeater.class,Heat.class,DoNotHeat.class},
                     exported={SwitchOnHeater.class,SwitchOffHeater.class,Heat.class,DoNotHeat.class})
public class HeaterStateModel
extends fr.sorbonne_u.devs_simulation.models.AtomicModel
implements HeaterOperationI
    The class HeaterStateModel defines a SIL simulation model that simulate the evolution of the state of the heater over time.

    Description

    In SIL simulation, the mode changes in the heater are controlled by the heater component which will issue external events into its simulation model. In the MIL implementation, such events are received both by the the HeaterElectricityModel and the HeaterTemperatureModel. In the SIL simulation, the HeaterElectricitySILModel will be executing inside the ElectricMeter component, not inside the ThermostatedHeater component. Therefore, events sent to it must be reemitted to the model in the ElectricMeter component.

    BCM4Java-CyPhy allows a component to issue an external event into its own simulation models, but not directly to models in other components. Hence, the present model is added to receive the events issued by the ThermostatedHeater component and reemit them to the HeaterElectricitySILModel in the ElectricMeter component.

    After taking care of the above, it turns out to be simpler to make this new HeaterStateModel responsible for also sending the events to the HeaterTemperatureSILModel.

    White-box Invariant

     invariant       true        // TODO // no more invariant

    Black-box Invariant

     invariant       URI != null && !URI.isEmpty()

    Created on : 2021-10-05

    Author:
    Jacques Malenfant
    See Also:
